comments:
Using Eclipse 3.0
JDK 1.4.2_03
Windows XP Home SP2

Starting eclipse with "c:<path to eclipse>\eclipse.exe" -data "d:<newly created 
path I have user access to>". I also have the working directory (in the Eclipse 
shortcut on my desktop) set to the same path as supplied with -data option.

I'm one of the few Windows users who for security reasons does not work on a 
computer as superuser/admin, so I try to do everything as a regular user with 
restricted rights. (as is usual in any *nix or multiuser environment)
When I try to start Eclipse 3 via the shortcut I get the error "An error has 
occured. See the log file c:\Programme\Tools\Eclipse3.
0\configuration\1094560620690.log."
Of course there is no such file as I do not have writing access to that 
directory. When doing a
java -cp <path to eclipse3>\startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
in a cmd window (same result whether I'm starting this from inside the Eclipse 
program path or from my wannabe-workspace path) I get:

!SESSION Sep 07, 2004 14:43:13.897 ---------------------------------------------

So that means SOMEWHERE Eclipse still tries to write to a file/directory it has 
no access to, even though I supplied necessary options to make it run in a 
different workspace.
Eclipse 2.1.3, which is also installed on this computer, works fine with the 
same configuration (not even using "-data", only setting working path in the 
shortcut).
Hope there is a fix/workaround for this (other than running program as admin).

Thanks in advance,
 Alex
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 69782 ***

Thank you Pascal for pointing me at the solution (couldn't even find Bug 69782 
after 20 minutes of search)
3.0.1R1 does not have the problem mentioned.
